MatrixComposition.comp_description: single population studied over a single time period, for example, over one year
a mean matrix was calculated by averaging across more than one population studied over a single time period, for example, over one year
a matrix was calculated by pooling data across more than one population studied over a single time period, for example, over one year
a mean matrix was calculated by averaging across multiple matrices associated with independent populations studied in differing locations over the same time period, for example, from 2015 to 2016
a mean matrix was calculated by averaging across matrices associated with a single population that was studied in a single location over multiple time periods, for example, annually from 2010 to 2016

a mean matrix was calculated by averaging across multiple matrices associated with independent populations studied in differing locations over multiple time periods, for example, populations a, b and c were studied annually from 2010 to 2016

StudiedSex.sex_description: Males and females separately in the same population matrix model

Captivity.cap_description: Captive: studied for most part of the life cycle of the species in a botanical garden, green house, laboratory, etc
Captured from Wild: If the species was taken from a wild population but studied in labs or gardens etc
